text: Fiscal Year 2010 Commerce, Justice, Science, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act
label: HH1

text: Friday, 19 June 2009 00:00
label: BODY

text: This legislation makes significant investments in two of our nation's top priorities--protecting
label: TITLE

text: Americans at home and in their communities, and encouraging scientific research and
label: BODY

text: innovation.
label: BODY

text: One of the fundamental responsibilities of our government is ensuring the safety and security of
label: BODY

text: our citizens by keeping our streets and neighborhoods safe. One of the most successful crime
label: BODY

text: fighting programs in recent history is the Community Oriented Policing Services (COPS)
label: BODY

text: program. This bill provides $802 million overall for the program and $282 million for COPS
label: BODY

text: hiring grants. When combined with the $1 billion provided in the Recovery Act, more than 7,000
label: BODY

text: police offices will be hired nationwide, 287 of those in New Jersey.
label: BODY

text: Through this bill, the Office of Justice Programs will receive $2.2 billion, $155 million over the
label: BODY

text: Fiscal Year 2009 level. Programs such as the Edward Byrne Memorial Justice Assistance
label: BODY

text: Grants Program will receive $529 million to assist state and local law enforcement agencies in
label: BODY

text: their efforts to control domestic crime as well as combat violent crimes, particular gang and
label: BODY

text: drug-related criminal activity.
label: BODY

text: The bill also provides $400 million ($11 million over the 2009 level) to the Office on Violence
label: BODY

text: Against Women to aid in the prevention and prosecution of violent crime against women. Funds
label: BODY

text: allocated by this bill will be used to strengthen the services available to victims of domestic
label: BODY

text: violence, sexual assault and stalking.
label: BODY

text: In the area of science funding, the bill provides over $30 billion to support research at the
label: BODY

text: National Science Foundation, the National Institute of Standards and Technology, the National
label: BODY

text: Aeronautics and Space Administration, and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric
label: BODY

text: Administration. The appropriations in this bill support the plan to double funding for basic
label: BODY

text: research, as expressed by Congress in the American COMPETES Act. History shows that our
label: BODY

text: country and our economy benefit when the federal government invests in our national
label: BODY

text: innovation and intellectual infrastructure.
label: BODY

text: Fiscal Year 2010 Commerce, Justice, Science, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act
label: HH1

text: Friday, 19 June 2009 00:00
label: BODY

text: This bill helps our students succeed in a global job market by investing $1 billion to support all
label: BODY

text: aspects of science, technology, engineering and math (STEM) education from kindergarten
label: BODY

text: through graduate school. It is imperative that we ensure our future generations are equipped
label: BODY

text: with the skills they need to be capable participants in a scientific and technological workforce.
label: BODY

text: Our economic growth is intertwined with our ability to remain competitive in the areas of Science
label: BODY

text: and Technology. I want to thank the subcommittee chair, Mr. Mollohan, and the chairman of the
label: BODY

text: full committee, Mr. Obey, for demonstrating a commitment to make meaningful investments in
label: BODY

text: science education to guarantee the success of our children in this global market place.
label: BODY

text: I also am pleased that the bill includes over $2 billion to study global climate change,
label: BODY

text: undoubtedly one of the greatest challenges facing our Nation. Over $700 million will be used by
label: BODY

text: the National Science Foundation and National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration for
label: BODY

text: climate change research and educational programs. The Geophysical Fluid Dynamics
label: BODY

text: Laboratory in my district is leading the national effort in climate change research by employing
label: BODY

text: sophisticated mathematical models and computer simulations to improve our knowledge and
label: BODY

text: ability to predict climatic behavior and trends. An additional investment of over $1.3 billion will
label: BODY

text: be used to develop measurement techniques and for green building initiatives nationwide. It is
label: BODY

text: vital to both our economic and our national security that we take whatever measures are
label: BODY

text: necessary to gain a comprehensive understanding of the mechanisms that drive global warming
label: BODY

text: in order to implement the full range of measures necessary to combat it.
label: BODY

text: Finally, this bill also ensures that we will be able to conduct an accurate decennial Census in
label: BODY

text: 2010. On top of the $1 billion that was provided for the Census in the American Recovery and
label: BODY

text: Reinvestment Act, this bill matches the President's request for $7.4 billion to conduct the largest
label: BODY

text: and most advanced Census in our nation's history.
label: BODY

text: I commend the committee for bringing us a bill that reflects the priorities of the American people,
label: BODY

text: and I urge my colleagues to vote for it.
label: BODY
